issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Recent GA block device map QA tests are consistently failing this unit w/ multiple storage backends. The root volume is not adhering to it's DOT( 'delete on termination' ) flag. In this case the DOT flag is to 'true' but the volume is made available after terminating the instance. 

This test sequence tests for DOT state at multiple instance states, block device maps, and DOT settings and we only see this in this particular unit.
This was found by a typo in the test causing the instance to be terminated in the 'stopped' state. A similar test (which terminates the instance in stopped state with root dev DOT=True) is done in a controlled manner immediately after this and the controlled test succeeds. This may be a timing issue, but the block device maps are slightly different in the working case. Test output pasted below, as well as the working block device map at the bottom. 
Thanks,
-Matt



Test Output
{code}
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
STARTING TESTUNIT: misc_test3_run_image1_check_attached_volume_states_during_stop_start
METHOD:misc_test3_run_image1_check_attached_volume_states_during_stop_start, TEST DESCRIPTION:

        Attempts To Run Test Bfebs Image#1 And Test The Following:
        -Add An Additional Ebs Block Device In The Map Built From The Base Test Snapshot
        -Verify The Root Device Is Present And In Bdm And By Checksum On The Guest
        -Verify The Root Device'S Size Specified In The Bdm Is Also The Size Which Appears On The Running Guest
        -Verify The Additional Ebs Device Is Present And In Bdm And By Checksum On The Guest
        -Verify The Additional Ebs Device'S Size Specified In The Bdm Is Also The Size Which Appears On The Running Guest
        -Verify Instance Meta Data For Block Device Mapping
        -Attach A Volume While Instance Is In Running State, Verify Device On Guest
        -Stop The Instance And Verify The Instance Goes To Stopped State Correctly
        -While In The Stopped State Monitor All Volumes Attached To Instance For 60 Seconds To Confirm Correct State
        -Monitor Instance For 60 Seconds To Verify It Remains In Correct Stopped State
        -Attempt To Detach Volume While Instance Is In Stopped State
        -Start Instance And Verify All Volumes Are Attached, Check Guest For Devices By Checksum


        
End on Failure:False

comments.body:
FYI...
This looks similar to EUCA-5772. These 2 tests were added to catch this case. The original tests pass, but looks like there's still some variation on the test that will fail. 
Thanks,
-M

Verified by running the block device mapping test suite against a few systems.This includes several tests for terminating a stopped instance and checking the volumes states per delete on terminate settings.  All tests passed.
